I would particularly urge my young friends to join tomorrow’s interaction. It is a wonderful way to learn, grow & get inspired. You can join the interaction via the ‘Narendra Modi Mobile App’ or @DDNewsLive. If you have any idea or suggestion, do share it on social media.

India has emerged a hub for start-ups and innovation. Indian youngsters have distinguished themselves due to their futuristic and out-of-the-box thinking. During tomorrow’s interaction youngsters from leading incubation centres and tinkering labs will be taking part as well.

Tomorrow at 9:30 AM, I will take part in an exciting interaction with youngsters from the world of start-ups & innovation. The interaction offers a wonderful opportunity to hear directly from pioneering young innovators who have excelled as start-up entrepreneurs.

Mudra Yojana has emerged as a job multiplier. Entrepreneurs, particularly in smaller towns and villages who were forced to depend on middlemen or moneylenders are relieved due to Mudra Yojana. This initiative places faith on the skills and strengths of 125 crore Indians.

During today's interaction with Mudra Yojana beneficiaries, I heard entrepreneurs from Maharashtra, Karnataka, Assam, West Bengal, Jammu and Kashmir, and Himachal Pradesh share their life journeys. Due to Mudra, the entrepreneurial potential of young Indians is being harnessed.

At 9:30 AM today, I will interact with Mudra Yojana beneficiaries from all over India. Looking forward. This interaction can be watched on @DDNewsLive and the 'Narendra Modi Mobile App.'https://www.narendramodi.in/watch-live

The focus of my Singapore visit is to enhance the India-Singapore partnership. During the visit I would be meeting students and CEOs. I will unveil a plaque at Clifford Pier, where Gandhi Ji's ashes were immersed in sea on 27th March 1948.

Here is why Premchand’s Idgah touched me deeply…and why it gives strength to our resolve of providing gas connections to every family.pic.twitter.com/HRQP29mN4J

Ujjwala Yojana is bringing a massive social transformation. Majority of the beneficiaries are women, and those belonging to SC, ST and OBC Communities. For decades, they never had access to gas connections…this has changed and today they are much happier!

Hearing the beneficiaries made me extremely happy. They told me that due to Ujjwala Yojana they are not only spending less time cooking but also learning stitching and other skills. Some of the beneficiaries said that due to Ujjwala they could spend more time with their children.

I will always remember today’s interaction with beneficiaries of the Ujjwala Yojana. Women from different parts of India shared their experiences on how this initiative has transformed their lives. Do hear.http://nm-4.com/cwf6
You can watch this interaction with Ujjwala beneficiaries live on @DDNewsLive and on the 'Narendra Modi Mobile App.'https://www.narendramodi.in/watch-live
At 9:30 AM, will take part in a special kind of interaction, with beneficiaries of the Ujjwala Yojana from all over India. Looking forward.

Odisha Government has misled the people of the state on the waters of the Mahanadi. Besides that, their efforts to improve irrigation for farmers is dismal. BJP will do justice to the farmers of Odisha.pic.twitter.com/zDU0OPbWS3

Reforms like neem coated urea, soil health cards, using technology to improve irrigation has helped the hardworking farmers of India. We are well poised to fulfil our dream of doubling the income of farmers by 2022, when India marks 75 years of Independence.

We have transformed systems to ensure better quality of living and more opportunities for the neo-middle class and middle class. This includes removing archaic laws, abolishing interviews for Group C and D government jobs, and transforming the education system.

Spoke at length about the transformative potential of the Ujjwala Yojana, Mudra Yojana, social security schemes of the NDA Government. I am glad that the maximum beneficiaries of these schemes are women, people belonging to SC, ST and OBC communities.pic.twitter.com/BlbgUyiVAE

Our aim is: Complete financial inclusion. Housing for all. Proper sanitation coverage for everyone. Electrify each and every household. Top quality infrastructure. Focus on the development of the Northeast, which was ignored by believers of ‘Family First’ agenda.

Our working in the last 48 months illustrates what a Government can achieve when the guiding motto is ‘India First.’ This is in direct contrast to those who ruled for 48 years driven by the selfish agenda of ‘Family First.’ Due to their personal agenda, India suffered.pic.twitter.com/AZ2Vf6EUtt

NDA Government is one of unwavering commitment, not confusion. When commitment, and not confusion drives the Government's work, we can take strong measures against corruption, we can make numerous efforts to remove poverty, we can leverage latest technology in governance.pic.twitter.com/d7Z9YOHCgh

The message of ‘Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas’ is reverberating in every part of India. Every section of society has been positively impacted by the development initiatives of the NDA Government. NDA Government runs with the blessings of Janmat and not the whims of Janpath.pic.twitter.com/yKqBmsbruG

Gram Swaraj Abhiyan was a success due to the active participation of Ministers, MPs, MLAs, representatives of various local bodies, officials of the state governments, topmost officers of the Central government, civil society members and Self Help Groups. I thank them all.

From 14th April to 5th May 2018: 20,53,599 Jan Dhan beneficiaries were added. 16,14,388 Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana beneficiaries were added. 26,10,506 beneficiaries were added under Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana.

During 21 days of Gram Swaraj Abhiyan: 7.53 lakh Ujjwala connections distributed. 5,02,434 households electrified under Saubhagya Yojana. 25.03 lakh LED bulbs distributed across 16,682 villages. Immunisation of 1,64,398 children and 42,762 women under Mission Indradhanush.

As a part of the Gram Swaraj Abhiyan, various teams ventured across the villages and ensured complete coverage of 7 leading Central Government schemes. This movement is a great example of effective service delivery at the doorstep and furthering ease of living.

I am delighted to share with you key details of the Gram Swaraj Abhiyan, a unique movement initiated by the Government of India. The aim was to take the fruits of development to the poorest of the poor in 16,850 villages from 14th April to 5th May as a tribute to Dr. Ambedkar.
